result.execSummary:
The defendant Tommie Sherman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants payment plan of $50 per month beginning April 1, 2017. Failure to pay will result in one day in jail for every $25 outstanding.
Defendant to submit DNA sample within 30 days.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tommie Sherman in court with attorney Lauria Ann Lynch-German.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State makes recommendation. Counsel addresses court. Court renders sentence.
Sentencing hearing on February 9, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Lauria Ann Lynch-German in court.  Shannon Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not in court. Motion to Revoke Deferred Prosecution Agreement. State addresses motion. Defendant has not complied with any of the conditions and moves to withdraw DPA and set a date for sentencing. Counsel indicates defendant was in schooling but is in agreement that monthly reports were not filed. Court revokes DPA.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 9, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Motion hearing on December 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.
to Terminate DPA.  Forwarded as document for review to Branch 2 Clerk.
Proposed Deferred Prosecution Agreement with proposed Order

Defendant Tommie Sherman in court with attorney Lauria Ann Lynch-German.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requesting matter be rescheduled to allow time to get information in order for deferred prosection agreement. Court, matter can be resolved today and outstanding issue may be determined at a later date. Court breaks. 1:50 pm/Case recalled. Defendant Tommie Sherman in court with attorney Lauria Ann Lynch-German.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deferred Prosecution Agreement filed. Court examines defendant and accepts plea. Court withholds finding of guilty. Once program is determined, Court will sign agreement. Counsel to notify clerk by email. Once obtained, program name to be completed on agreement and agreement will be executed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tommie Sherman in court with attorney Lauria Ann Lynch-German.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel enters not guilty plea and requests plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
conditions:   Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.

Defendant Tommie Sherman in court with attorney Lauria Ann Lynch-German.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel has received copy of complaint and waives reading. Court finds probable cause. State requests $500 signature bond with conditions. Court sets bail.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
